data.title: Countries that use the Pacific franc
data.meta_description: Usage and exchange rates of the Pacific franc. Convert XPF to any other currency.
data.text:
The Pacific franc was established in 1945 as an official currency and is used in French Polynesia, in New Caledonia and in Wallis and Futuna. 1 Franc is devided into 100 Centimes.

Since 1999, the Pacific franc is tied to the euro with a fixed exchange rate. Therefore, 1 franc always equals to 0.0084 euro.

ISO 4127:

XPF

Numeric:
